perturbation.original_text: In certain cases, Leclanché may request progress payments, including some element paid at the time of order. In the absence of a specific payment schedule, all payment terms are 30 days net from date of invoice.
perturbation.changed_text: In certain cases, Leclanché may request progress payments, including some element paid at the time of order. In the absence of a specific payment schedule, all payment terms are 30 days net from date of invoice. Notwithstanding the foregoing, for all projects initiated after January 1, 2025, payment terms shall be net 60 days from the date of invoice.
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces a contradiction by stating that payment terms are generally 30 days, but then specifies a 60-day payment term for projects starting after a certain date. This creates ambiguity about which payment terms apply, leading to potential disputes.

perturbation.original_text: Each party's intellectual property ("IP") in existence as of the Effective Date shall remain such Party's property. Where appropriate and to the extent required, each party undertakes to grant a royalty free license to the other Party solely for the design and development of product(s) under this Agreement. There is no intended or implied transfer of either Party's Intellectual Property to the other.
perturbation.changed_text: Each party's intellectual property ("IP") in existence as of the Effective Date shall remain such Party's property. Where appropriate and to the extent required, each party undertakes to grant a royalty free license to the other Party solely for the design and development of product(s) under this Agreement. There is no intended or implied transfer of either Party's Intellectual Property to the other. However, any IP developed jointly during the term of this agreement shall be owned equally by both parties, unless otherwise agreed in writing.
perturbation.explanation: The original clause states no transfer of IP, but the addition now grants joint ownership of jointly developed IP, which implicitly transfers rights. This contradicts the original intent and creates uncertainty about IP ownership.

The original clause details specific reasons for termination, but the addition grants Leclanché the right to terminate at any time without cause with 90 days' notice. This contradicts the listed reasons for termination and creates uncertainty about when/how the agreement can be terminated.
